thread.title: Rhode Island governor says Amgen will build another plant in state

title: Rhode Island governor says Amgen will build another plant in state
text:
April 10, 2018 / 3:58 PM / a minute ago Rhode Island governor says Amgen will build another plant in state Deena Beasley 1 Min Read 
April 10 (Reuters) - Amgen Inc will build a $165 million next-generation biopharmaceutical plant adjacent to its existing West Greenwich, Rhode Island manufacturing campus, the state governor’s office told Reuters on Tuesday. 
Amgen, headquartered in Thousand Oaks, California, in January announced plans to build a $300 million plant using new more flexible, reconfigurable technology in the United States, due in part to a lower effective tax rate stemming from U.S. tax reform. 
Because the selected site is adjacent to an existing plant, the cost is now estimated at $165 million. The plant is expected to create at least 150 new manufacutring jobs, about half of Amgen’s initial estimate of 300. (Reporting By Deena Beasley; Editing by David Gregorio)
